entry.title: CFGO
entry.content: CFGO is a commercial AM radio station in Ottawa, Ontario, broadcasting on 1200 kHz. It is owned by Bell Media and broadcasts a sports radio format, using the brand name TSN 1200 Ottawa. The radio studios and offices are in the Bell Media Building on George Street in Downtown Ottawa’s ByWard Market. CFGO features local Ottawa sports shows most of the day, with programming from TSN Radio, ESPN Radio and Fox Sports Radio nights and weekends. CFGO is the flagship station for the Ottawa Senators NHL team.
entry.summary: CFGO is a commercial AM radio station in Ottawa, Ontario, broadcasting on 1200 kHz. It is owned by Bell Media and broadcasts a sports radio format, using the brand name TSN 1200 Ottawa. The radio studios and offices are in the Bell Media Building on George Street in Downtown Ottawa’s ByWard Market. CFGO features local Ottawa sports shows most of the day, with programming from TSN Radio, ESPN Radio and Fox Sports Radio nights and weekends. CFGO is the flagship station for the Ottawa Senators NHL team.

entry.title: Shameless (Camila Cabello song)
entry.content: “Shameless” is a song by American singer and songwriter Camila Cabello from her second studio album Romance (2019). It was released alongside “Liar” on September 5, 2019, as a double lead single from the album. Written by Cabello, Ali Tamposi, Andrew Watt, Jon Bellion, Martin Bresso, Jordan Johnson and Stefan Johnson, and produced by Watt and the Monsters and the Strangerz, the song is about Cabello finally facing her feelings about someone she loved. The song reached the top 10 in Hungary.
entry.summary: “Shameless” is a song by American singer and songwriter Camila Cabello from her second studio album Romance (2019). It was released alongside “Liar” on September 5, 2019, as a double lead single from the album. Written by Cabello, Ali Tamposi, Andrew Watt, Jon Bellion, Martin Bresso, Jordan Johnson and Stefan Johnson, and produced by Watt and the Monsters and the Strangerz, the song is about Cabello finally facing her feelings about someone she loved. The song reached the top 10 in Hungary.

entry.title: Zámostí-Blata
entry.content: Zámostí-Blata is a municipality in Jičín District in the Hradec Králové Region of the Czech Republic. It has about 100 inhabitants.
entry.summary: Zámostí-Blata is a municipality in Jičín District in the Hradec Králové Region of the Czech Republic. It has about 100 inhabitants.

entry.title: François Victor Le Tonnelier de Breteuil

link.title: François Victor Le Tonnelier de Breteuil

entry.content: François Victor Le Tonnelier de Breteuil was a French nobleman. He was minister for war twice under Louis XV. He was also chancelier, garde des sceaux de la Maison de la reine and commander, provost and grandmaster of ceremonies to the Order of the Holy Spirit (1721–1743).
entry.summary: François Victor Le Tonnelier de Breteuil was a French nobleman. He was minister for war twice under Louis XV. He was also chancelier, garde des sceaux de la Maison de la reine and commander, provost and grandmaster of ceremonies to the Order of the Holy Spirit (1721–1743).

entry.title: John Henry Mackay
entry.content: John Henry Mackay was a Scottish-German egoist anarchist, thinker and writer. Born in Scotland and raised in Germany, Mackay was the author of Die Anarchisten and Der Freiheitsucher.
entry.summary: John Henry Mackay was a Scottish-German egoist anarchist, thinker and writer. Born in Scotland and raised in Germany, Mackay was the author of Die Anarchisten and Der Freiheitsucher.

entry.title: Religion in Tibet
entry.content: The main religion in Tibet has been Buddhism since its introduction in the 8th century AD. As of 2022 the historical region of Tibet mostly comprises the Tibet Autonomous Region (TAR) of China and partly the Chinese provinces of Qinghai, Sichuan, Gansu, and Yunnan. Before the arrival of Buddhism, the main religion among Tibetans was an indigenous shamanic and animistic religion, Bon, which would later influence the formation of Tibetan Buddhism and still attracts the allegiance of a sizeable minority of Tibetans.
entry.summary: The main religion in Tibet has been Buddhism since its introduction in the 8th century AD. As of 2022 the historical region of Tibet mostly comprises the Tibet Autonomous Region (TAR) of China and partly the Chinese provinces of Qinghai, Sichuan, Gansu, and Yunnan. Before the arrival of Buddhism, the main religion among Tibetans was an indigenous shamanic and animistic religion, Bon, which would later influence the formation of Tibetan Buddhism and still attracts the allegiance of a sizeable minority of Tibetans.

entry.title: James Cocker & Sons
entry.content: James Cocker and Sons is a nursery business located in Aberdeen, Scotland. Founded in 1841 by James Cocker, the company has been owned by the Cocker family for five generations. During the last seventy years, the nursery has introduced more than 100 new rose varieties and holds Royal Warrants from Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother, and the Prince of Wales. James Cocker & Sons is best known for creating the hybrid tea rose, ‘Silver Jubilee’, the popular rose named in honour of the Queen’s 25 years reign. The rose was developed by Alec Cocker, and introduced by his wife, Anne Cocker, after Alec’s death in 1977. Anne continued to breed roses and manage the company until she was in her eighties. She won multiple horticultural awards and was internationally recognized for her work.
entry.summary: James Cocker and Sons is a nursery business located in Aberdeen, Scotland. Founded in 1841 by James Cocker, the company has been owned by the Cocker family for five generations. During the last seventy years, the nursery has introduced more than 100 new rose varieties and holds Royal Warrants from Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother, and the Prince of Wales. James Cocker & Sons is best known for creating the hybrid tea rose, ‘Silver Jubilee’, the popular rose named in honour of the Queen’s 25 years reign. The rose was developed by Alec Cocker, and introduced by his wife, Anne Cocker, after Alec’s death in 1977. Anne continued to breed roses and manage the company until she was in her eighties. She won multiple horticultural awards and was internationally recognized for her work.

entry.title: Luis Dávila Pernas
entry.content: Luis Daniel Dávila Pernas is a Puerto Rican government official who served as the executive director of the Puerto Rico Federal Affairs Administration from March 20, 2023 to January 2, 2025. In 2024, he was elected chair of the Democratic Party of Puerto Rico.
entry.summary: Luis Daniel Dávila Pernas is a Puerto Rican government official who served as the executive director of the Puerto Rico Federal Affairs Administration from March 20, 2023 to January 2, 2025. In 2024, he was elected chair of the Democratic Party of Puerto Rico.

entry.title: Recorded Live at Oil Can Harry’s

link.title: Recorded Live at Oil Can Harry’s

entry.content: Recorded Live at Oil Can Harry’s is a live album by American jazz pianist Ahmad Jamal, featuring four pieces recorded at Oil Can Harry’s, a nightclub in Vancouver, on August 13, 1976.
entry.summary: Recorded Live at Oil Can Harry’s is a live album by American jazz pianist Ahmad Jamal, featuring four pieces recorded at Oil Can Harry’s, a nightclub in Vancouver, on August 13, 1976.

entry.title: Corythomantis
entry.content: Corythomantis is a small genus of hylid frogs endemic to northeastern Brazil. It was monotypic until description of a second species, Corythomantis galeata in 2012, though this species was later moved to Nyctimantis. Corythomantis botoque was described in 2021. These frogs are sometimes known under common name Greening’s frogs.
entry.summary: Corythomantis is a small genus of hylid frogs endemic to northeastern Brazil. It was monotypic until description of a second species, Corythomantis galeata in 2012, though this species was later moved to Nyctimantis. Corythomantis botoque was described in 2021. These frogs are sometimes known under common name Greening’s frogs.
